args: All troops, assume formation.\nOur assault begins now.
Captain Harle, we've enemies incoming!\nIt's the White Sparrow Corps!
Do not lose composure! White Sparrows\nor no, they are but a small, mewling force!\nAll they will find with us is blood and dust!
White Sparrows, charge! We shall\nbreak through and strike their core!
My, but you are a boisterous little lass.\nLet's shut you up, shall we?
Your opponent is me, Harle—and I will\nnot let you anywhere near the Halidom!
Harle... You once served the kingdom the\nsame as I, and yet now you turn your blade\nagainst His Highness. This I cannot abide!
You are a disgrace as a knight!
Aaaah ha ha! Oh, but that is rich!\nYOU would speak to ME about disgrace?

It is the height of comedy that a disloyal
cur who stabbed Empress Zethia in the
back would think to lecture another on
the way of knighthood!
Have you taken up a new occupation\nas a jester, perhaps? Shall I pelt you\nwith moldy fruit from the boxes?
Have you noticed how your sword falters?
You once told me that a knight's duty\nis to protect the royal family.
Those words are the rantings of a fool!
With the royal family now splintered,\nnot only can we not protect them all,\nbut none wish for us to do so!
I know you understand this, else why\nwould your blade falter as it does?
...It's true. Things are as you say.
The sovereign I serve is only one of many\nwho might eventually sit upon the throne.
Still, I wish for each member of the royal\nfamily to find happiness and peace.
And I'm telling you that dream is\nimpossible! Pull your head from the\nclouds and face—
But there is one person who can\nachieve that goal.

He is a tireless seeker of peace, and if he
becomes king, he will fight to protect both
the peace of the realm AND the stability
of the royal family.
His Highness {player_name} is\na lord who ought be served!
Ahhh, there it is at last: You would see\nthat traitorous whelp made king and\npledge your sword to his cause.
So even the incomparable White Sparrow\nhimself has fallen. ...A true pity.
I would bear any dishonor gladly if it\nmeant being able to protect His Highness.
Tsk! You're as large a pain as ever!
The White Sparrow Corps' treachery\nis plain as daylight! Black Raven Corps,\nannihilate the traitors!
Dys fahr Dyrenell! Dys fahr Dyrenell!
White Sparrows, now is the time for you\nto show your devotion to Alberia!
Just as I expected from the Sparrows.\nYou are each elite, and you push\nmy Ravens to their very limits.
Prepare yourself, Harle. Your clandestine\nmachinations end here.
Mmm, I wonder which of us\nwill meet our end this day?
Captain, we're being stormed from our\nflank! We've been ambushed!

Just as you read my actions, so, too,
did I expect you would come for me.
I could hardly have not prepared a
suitable welcome for you, old friend!
My prey was ALWAYS the White Sparrows!
We can't hold them off for long, Captain!
Alas, I imagine this will be the end\nof our long, complicated relationship.\nLet us settle things for good, Leif!
Sir, I bring news! The traitorous prince\nhimself has arrived and is cutting his way\nthrough the troops we left in ambush!
There are only a few ambush troops!\nLet's take them out and join up with\nLeif and the Sparrows!
Black Ravens? Ha! Black CRAVENS is\nmore like it! ...Damn, that was good.\nHope somebody wrote it down.
This can't be... They should be\nback defending the castle!
We're left with no other option.\nRelease the fiends.
But sir, releasing the fiends will turn the\nbattle into an all-out brawl. All of our\ncareful planning will be for naught.
It's crucial for one to know when to quit.\nFor today, we'll have them expend their\ntroops on the fiends.
I thought you wanted to settle\nthings, Harle!
Yes, well, I always was a dirty liar. \nWe'll have to save that for another time.
I look forward to seeing just how long\nyou can continue to pontificate on duty\nand loyalty, Leif! Ta taaaa!
That was the last of the fiends,\nand the imperial army has fallen back.
I thank you for your assistance,\nYour Highness.
I'm just glad you're all okay.
But I requested that you attend to the\nprotection of the castle, Your Highness.\nWhy did you decide to come here?
Because I had a feeling you were\nHarle's real target.
I thought he might be putting on a show of\nattacking the Halidom in order to whittle\ndown the strength of the White Sparrows.
Nothing quite that impressive.\nLet's just say I was worried and\nfollowed my gut.
After hearing His Highness's concerns,\nwe sent a scout to the battlefield.
They saw the ambush and came a'runnin'\nback to tell us about it.
You have grown skilled, Your Highness.\nThe day would have been much darker\nindeed if not for your courage.
Uh, Leif? Why are you kneeling...?
The time has come for me\nto swear my allegiance.
Your Highness, the White Sparrow Corps\nhas long been granted autonomy by the\nkingdom of Alberia.
But from this moment forth,\nwe swear our fealty to you alone!
You are a ruler worthy of being served.
We serve you alone, and shall work at\nyour side to bring peace to the kingdom.
And in that case, I swear I will never\nbetray the faith you've placed in me.
Whatever may come, I will make this a\nnation where all can live in peace.
I look forward to the day.
Know then that the sword of the\nWhite Sparrow shall be with you\nuntil that glorious moment arrives!
